div.head: John Ashbrooke Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. The last will and testament of John
Ashbrooke in Charles County being in perfect memory.
I give and bequeath my soule unto the Almighty God and my body to
be entered in the ground and in it to be desently buried as my dear wife
shall see to it.

2d I give and bequeath unto my loving wife one chow call by the name of
Juyne with a chow calf by her side now naming. I give unto my sonne James
one chow called by the name of fortune and two yearlings being heiffers
and come of the above said chow Juyne and all the land that at this
present belongs and dappertains unto me the sd. John onely my wife to enjoy
the sd. land for her life time provided she keeps herself unmaryed but
is that she should mary that the the said James shall tke the said land
into his possession and that my wife shall have nothing to do with it.

3d I give and bequeath unto my Daughter Keese one yoing heafer at two years
of age Called by the name of Gentle.

4 I give and bequeath unto my Daughter Elizabeth one three year olf heaffer
Called by the name of Ham.
